subject: Perl QA hackathon is looking for sponsors!
header: let me first thank Yanick for putting together the previous two issues while I was on winter vacation, and sorry to those who are currently being cooked in the southern hemisphere...

There are also a couple of things that need your further attention in this post. Upasana looking for answers looking for answer regarding Perl newbies, and Philippe Bruhat (BooK) looking for sponsors for the QA Hackathon.
You can now also see the schedule of the Perl dev-room at FOSDEM in Brussels. I wish I could attend...

entries.title: .nz Registry Services is hiring Perl Software Developers - New Zealand
entries.text: The work is across application, web-based & intranet development & your skills in OSS development are reqd. It is crucial you have used Perl, Moose, DBI::x, OO Perl, XML and have exp. with SQL, Linux and Revision control. You will have used HTML, CSS on a daily basis along with Internet protocols (HTTP, HTTPS, SMTP, DNS, Whois, EPP)

entries.text: Some improvements to Dist::Zilla to make bug reports of your module be more specific.

entries.title: Perl and Me, Part 6: Perl Is Engineering and Art
entries.text: Recently I was reading the Learning Python book and found a page titled 'Python Is Engineering, Not Art'. In the disguise of trying to explain the difference between Perl and Python it just bashes Perl. I sent it to bare-feet Buddy Burden, and he included an extensive post about this in his series about his journey in the world of Perl.

entries.title: Ditching A Language
entries.text: Ovid explains why replacing the programming language and rewriting your whole application might not solve all your problems after all, and how much can it cost you. Maybe your job?

entries.title: How to Rewrite Software without Destroying Your Business
entries.text: It is mostly aimed at managers, but the writing of chromatic can provide a good list of talking points when your managers starts to talk about rewriting a piece of software.

entries.title: Is Perl really short of newbies?
entries.text: A bothering question that comes up every now and then. This time Upasana, who is also a newbie to Perl, and the Perl community (she started to learn Perl in dec 2011) raises the question. Please, give her a hand with your opinion.

entries.title: Testing Random Dice Rolls
entries.text: Ovid shows how to check if the dice you are rolling (with your computer program) is cheating, or if the randomization works correctly.

entries.title: Support the Perl QA Hackathon 2014 in Lyon
entries.text: The Perl QA Hackathon is a wonderful annual event for improving Perl, the CPAN ecosystem and the whole community. (I attended two of them.) Participants and organizers invest a lot of time and energy in it, but there are also expenses. The organizers are looking for sponsors to cover these expenses.
